org.wiyn.etc.configuration
Class TelescopeProperties

java.lang.Object
  org.wiyn.etc.configuration.GenericProperties
      org.wiyn.etc.configuration.TelescopeProperties
All Implemented Interfaces:
AllowingPropertyChanges, PiptData, PiptSafelyAccessible
public class TelescopeProperties
extends GenericProperties
implements PiptData

This class provides the properties of the telescope. These comprise the zenith distance of the target, the effective mirror area, the seeing (in direction of the zenith) and the corresponding FWHM of the seeing disk in the focal plane. TODO: Eventually it might be beneficial to move the transmission function of the telescope mirrors here.

TelescopeProperties

public TelescopeProperties(double targetZenithDistance,
                           double effectiveArea,
                           double seeing)
Sets the telescope properties to the given values.

Parameters:
targetZenithDistance - the zenith distance of the target (in degrees)
effectiveArea - the effective mirror area (in cm^2)
seeing - the seeing (in direction of the zenith)
Method Detail

getFWHM

public double getFWHM()
Returns the FWHM of the seeing disk in the focal plane corresponding to the seeing and target zenith distance. We take into account the sec(z)^0.6 and add in quadrature the SALT PSF error budget (0.6").

Returns:
the FWHM of the seeing disk in the focal plane corresponding to the seeing (in arcseconds)

setAirmass

public void setAirmass(double airmass)
Sets the zenith distance of the target to the given value.

Parameters:
airmass - the zenith distance of the target (in degrees)

safeSetAirmass

public void safeSetAirmass(double airmass)
Checks whether the given value for the zenith distance of the target lies in the interval from 0 to 180 degrees and, if so, assigns it to the zenith distance of the target, using the setTargetZenithDistance() method.

Parameters:
airmass - the zenith distance of the target (in degrees)
Throws:
InvalidValueException - if the given zenith distance doesn't lie in the interval from 0 to 180 degrees

getAirmass

public double getAirmass()
Returns the zenith distance of the target.

Returns:
the zenith distance of the target (in degrees)

the effective mirror area (in cm^2)

public void setSeeing(double seeing)
Sets the seeing (in direction of the zenith).

Parameters:
seeing - the seeing (in arcseconds)

safeSetSeeing

public void safeSetSeeing(double seeing)
Checks whether the given seeing value is positive and, if so, assigns it to the seeing, using the setSeeing() method.

Parameters:
seeing - the seeing (in arcseconds)
Throws:
InvalidValueException - if the given seeing isn't positive
